cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 435 miles SSW of Mobile, Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: Moving due north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to bend northeastward across Mississippi and Alabama through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana / north-central Gulf Coast (near the Louisiana–Mississippi border)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, metropolitan New Orleans, and the entire Alabama coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana eastward through Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gusts 35–45 mph) possible Saturday as the center passes west of Mobile
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–3 ft of surge/inundation possible in Mobile Bay, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated 7 inches; flash and urban flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Saturday into early Sunday across southern Alabama
